description: Master Postman for API integration testing, collections, pre-request scripts, and test scripts

slides.title: Introduction to Postman
slides.content:
# Postman üöÄ

The world's leading API platform for developers to design, build, test, and iterate their APIs.

- **UI Based**: Explore APIs visually.
- **Automation**: Write tests in JavaScript.
- **Collections**: Group related requests.
- **Collaboration**: Share APIs with your team.

slides.title: Collections & Folders
slides.content:
# Organization üìÇ

Group requests into **Collections**. Use **Folders** for logical grouping (e.g., Auth, Users, Orders).

- **Benefits**: Share the whole collection at once, run all tests in bulk.

slides.title: Environments & Variables
slides.content:
# Dynamic APIs ‚öôÔ∏è

Don't hardcode URLs or tokens! Use **Variables**.

- **Global**: Available everywhere.
- **Environment**: Switch between Local, Staging, Production.
- **Collection**: Variables specific to one set of requests.

```
{{base_url}}/api/users/{{userId}}
```

slides.title: Asserting Response Body
Pre-request Scripts
slides.content:
# Setup Logic üõ†Ô∏è

Code in the **Pre-request Script** tab runs *before* the request is sent.

- **Use case**: Generating dynamic timestamps, hashing signatures, or clearing variables.

slides.title: Variable Chaining
Collection Runner
slides.content:
# Bulk Testing üèÉ

The **Collection Runner** executes all requests in a collection in order.

- Verify entire workflows (e.g., Create -> Get -> Update -> Delete).
- View a summary of passes and fails.

slides.quizQuestion: Which tab allows you to run code BEFORE the API request is made?
slides.title: Workflow Quiz
slides.content: Setup vs Teardown.

slides.title: Newman CLI
slides.content:
# CLI for CI/CD üíª

**Newman** is the command-line companion for Postman.

```bash
newman run my_collection.json -e my_env.json
```

Run your Postman collections in GitHub Actions or Jenkins!

slides.title: Postman Echo
slides.content:
# Learning APIs üì°

Postman provides `postman-echo.com`, a set of endpoints that echo back whatever you send them. Perfect for practicing scripts and variable manipulation.

slides.title: Mock Servers
slides.content:
# Simulation üèóÔ∏è

Postman can host **Mock Servers**. If your real backend isn't ready, the frontend team can hit Postman mocks that return pre-defined data.

slides.title: API Documentation
slides.content:
# Auto-Docs üìö

Postman automatically generates beautiful HTML documentation for your collections, including code snippets in C#, Python, JavaScript, and more.

slides.title: Authentication
slides.content:
# Auth Management üîê

Postman supports various auth types out of the box:

- API Key
- Bearer Token
- OAuth 2.0
- Basic Auth
- AWS Signature

slides.title: Workspaces
slides.content:
# Team Collaboration üë•

Use **Workspaces** to share collections and environments with teammates. Everyone sees the latest version real-time.

slides.title: Visualizer
slides.content:
# Data Visualization üìä

`pm.visualizer.set(template, data)` allows you to render JSON response data as HTML tables, charts, or maps right inside Postman.

slides.title: Postman API
slides.content:
# Programmatic Access üîë

You can use the Postman API to fetch your own collections or environments programmatically, useful for advanced automation.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üéâ

- ‚úÖ Use Collections for organization.
- ‚úÖ Leverage Environments for flexibility.
- ‚úÖ Write Tests in JS to automate validation.
- ‚úÖ Run everywhere with Newman.

Postman turns manual API testing into a professional automation suite! üöÄ
